name: Graves 601 Hotel Wyndham Grand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here in June when in Minneapolis for a concert at the Target Center. Having your hotel directly across the street from an event in an unfamiliar city is the best. The hotel is also close enough to great restaurants, theatres and the downtown mall, to walk. The skywalk system in Minneapolis is so extensive - makes getting around a breeze. Check in was smooth and fast.
reviews.title: Great hotel, amazing beds!

reviews.text: The room was clean, modern and very comfortable. The bed was unbelievablly comfortable with great pillows-we tried to buy some online but the site was not very user friendly.
reviews.title: Directly across the street from Target Center

reviews.text: The shower was huge with a overhead/full body shower system that was so wonderful and relaxing.
reviews.title: First Class Service at this Hotel

reviews.text: The only negative about our room was the sink/make up mirror area was very small and cramped - made it impossible for my husband and I to get ready at the same time and the sink took forever to drain even with the water just trickling- it was not plugged, just a very poor design. We would definitely stay at Graves 601 again.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very hip atmosphere, like a W property but with a little less effort. Beds are very, very comfortable with first class linens. There was a snafu with our reservation that was cleared up beyond our satisfaction.
reviews.title: Great atmosphere, beautiful decor, and comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived at about 5:00 p.m. we asked the front desk if we could get a portable crib sent to our room for our 1 year old baby, at 7:55 p.m. no crib so I called and asked again, at 8:25 I called again. By this time I had a cranky 1 year old. When it arrived after 8:30 the staff who delivered it was knocking on the wrong door so I looked in the hall and she just kind of pushed it at me and said nothing when I said "thanks" a bit knit picky on the reply but it's common manners to respond. The bathroom door lock was broken, call it a habbit but I lock a bathroom door when I go in, when I came out I didn't want the baby going in there so I closed it behind me. This locked the bathroom door. When I called room service we didn't see anyone for 50 minutes. I called back down to remind them of our bathroom door being broken, the little push buttom on the inside of the door was missing so you could press your finger into the inside and lock it but it wouldn't reset when you opened the bathroom door from the inside. We tried using a coin to open it ourselves but this didn't work. After the second call an engineer staff person came up and opened the door for us but did not fix the door so later that night when we closed the door it locked. My wife was embarrased so she didn't want me to call down about the bathroom again so we said forget it. The headboard of the bed was etched glass but behind the glass was a thick film of cotton dust lint and the occassional curly hair. The room on the 18th floor looked at the new Twins stadium, the Twins were in Cinncinatti but the lights from the park were turned on at 9:30 or so and it was like someone had pulled up to the window with their headlights on until after 11:30 I think. Not their fault but just something to be aware of during baseball season. I think it was the series of events and the fact that I thought I would have a suite that turned me off. I would probably say it was a 1.5 stars but I'll defer to lower rating because the memory is fresh. I've never wrote a review before and I believe this is a fair rating. I had high expectations and for the rate I expected much more than a jazzed up holiday inn with worse service.
reviews.title: overrated & poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great stay at Graves 601. Went to a Twins game (2 blocks from Target Field) on Sat.Hotel was ultra clean and quiet. Valet parking was worth the $28 price. Staff we met were very helpful.Finally, got a great rate on hotel website( $138 + tax for a king). We will be back.
reviews.title: Great hotel downtown

reviews.text: GETTING THERE
reviews.title: Great Rooms, Tacky Block

reviews.text: Everything you need to know to get to Graves 601 is on their website.
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel. Very helpful staff.

reviews.text: PRICE
reviews.title: Why would you ever want to stay here??????

reviews.text: With a posh atmosphere and swanky decor, Graves 601 represents modern luxury at its best. I was absolutely in love with the beds and could not get over the 5-head shower! Amazing! I was also very impressed when after I asked for ice delivered to my room, they came back one hour later to see if I needed more. I also enjoyed Bradstreet, the hotel's cocktail bar which specializes in mixology, but at $12/drink it's easy to run a high tab! See pictures and read about my stay at graves in my article at http://www.hotelpillowtalk.com
reviews.title: Jewel of the Twin Cities!

reviews.text: I recently returned from a week's stay in the Graves 601. I was in town on business, and my company gets a corporate rate from the Graves so I thought this would be a cool place to check out. The service here is definitely second-to-none. From the second you walk in, you are greeted by a very friendly doorman, and the front desk will very happily accommodate your needs. In fact, there is no ice maker accessible by the hotel guests, instead you just call down and they deliver it to your room--the longest I ever waited for this was maybe 2-3 minutes. The beds were comfortable, my only complaint is that one night it was difficult to sleep because a Timberwolves game had just gotten over and the noise from the street traffic is fairly loud. The main reason I say this place is good but not great is because there really isn't anything special about it--the room is a very average size and some of the furniture shows signs of wear and tear. The decor is very chic but also seems to be hastily assembled. Some of my favorite things about this place were the very large main TV, the TV in the bathroom, the lounger in the corner, and the very comfortable bedding. I think this hotel would be better for a weekend getaway for a couple than it would for a week-long business trip. I will be back in Minneapolis in June and I would say there is a 50/50 chance I will choose this hotel again.
reviews.title: Good, not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I hate driving when I go to a city for a concert so gave the Graves a try, what a great choice. I was 10 steps from First Ave, parked the car and didn't have to see it again until I left town. Checked in around 3:30 but room was still being cleaned, the front desk clerk was said she was sorry, I'm not someone to get upset about little things and the girl(can't recall the name) did a good job of explaining what was going on, only had to wait about 15 mins more so once again nothing major. Stayed in one of the executive corner rooms and man what an amazing view, once floor up and I could have watched the baseball game. Room was clean and the bed was like butter, bathroom was also very cool. I don't even want to use my shower at home after using the 5 head shower they had.
reviews.title: Dowtown perfection

reviews.text: Didn't deal too much with the staff after checking in but they all where nice and helpful when I did see them.
reviews.title: Very Disappointing-Rude Service

reviews.text: Only complaint I have is kind of small, there was one wall plug in our room that we plugged are cellphones into at the end of the night, turns out once you turn off the lights that plug in no longer works, so when we went to leave both of us had dead phones. Also would be nice to have a coffee maker in the room, I want to wake up in the morning and have a cup, not sit and wait for room service or walk down to the starbucks.
reviews.title: Luxury and Convenience next to First Avenue and the Target Center

reviews.text: The Graves is a perfectly pleasant hotel. I had business in Minneapolis and found this hotel on one of the Priceline like services as Minneapolis can be very expensive. Like other reviewers mentioned, the furniture is a bit Ikea like, but the bed was amazingly comfortable and the shower and was great. Staff seemed kind and room was super clean.
reviews.title: perfectly pleasant

reviews.text: Check-in is a little weird. You check-in at the bottom of a business lobby and go to the fourth floor thru a restaurant to your elevator. It's not really a problem, just a little weird...
reviews.title: Beautiful!

reviews.text: There is a Starbucks in the same lobby for those that like that sort of thing.
reviews.title: This the best hotel I have stayed in thus far

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately, I was given a room that faced a white wall and had absolute zero visibility - but I suppose every hotel has terrible view rooms. Ask for something on a high floor.
reviews.title: Best damn martini I have had other than New York City & Paris...

reviews.text: Overall, I would stay here again because the location is good and the rooms are clean, though I would not pay regular price. It's really a 175 dollar room and they are charging almost double that.
reviews.title: Love this hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here the weekend of December 10-12, 2010, celebrating a 40th birthday. This was also the same weekend as the blizzard of the year when the dome collapsed and the city came to a complete stand still, but not the Graves!
reviews.title: All Hotels Should Be Like This!

reviews.text: This hotel is outstanding! This is by far the best room I have ever stayed in. The hotel is modern and contemporary. The only thing that was odd is the fact that you have to take the elevator up to the second floor only to exit and walk around the corner to access the next set of elevators.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Retreat, even on Business Trip

reviews.text: The rooms were excellent! They have huge bathrooms with TVs. Our room looked out at Target Center which was right across the street. We couldn't see it though because of the snow storm.The highlight of the room, however, was the bed. It was heavenly! I actuallly called the hotel after our stay to find out what the mattress was--we have never slept better! The housekeeping manager called me right back with all of the information which in and of itself was impressive.
reviews.title: Half and Lower Half Feelings towards this place

reviews.text: Despite the blizzard all of the common areas remained clean and orderly. The valets were coming in and assisting housekeeping with keeping the floors dry (as best they could). The staff had great attitudes even though their relief workers weren't able to get into work. The staff were all friendly and helpful!
reviews.title: Nice hotel with issues

reviews.text: I can't recommend this property enough! I can't wait to go back!!
reviews.title: Modern stylish design coupled with excellent service

reviews.text: I stayed here for 1 night on a business trip and thought it was amazing. The art installations that they have throughout the hotel add a lot to the atmosphere. The rooms are modern with little extras throughout that you just wouldn't expect. Their use of lighting throughout the whole hotel is pretty spectacular. The beds are super comfy. It is located right downtown in the heart of restaurants and other entertainment. I didn't pay the bill, so I can't really comment on the value.
reviews.title: I loved this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a few issues/disappointments I feel require attention for future guests' enjoyment. We chose an upgraded room-a corner view on the 14th floor. For the price paid, I feel that some items were inconvenient and/or unreasonable. Those items are as follows:
reviews.title: There is better value for your money elsewhere
Best hotel experience of my life!
reviews.text: -Glass headboard

While very attractive overall, there was a visible and off-putting thick layer of dust directly behind the glass piece, made more noticeable by the headboard lights. This made me question the dust/allergen level in the rest of the room.
reviews.title: Swanky. Reminds me of the W.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Internet
reviews.title: Looks cool, but stay was incredibly disappointing

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for a conference recently. The decor is just different enough to keep you interested in looking around all the time -- and even allows you to overlook some of the signs of use and age that come with any hotel. Interesting glass arrangements on the walls, nice amenities in the rooms. Wi-fi signal strong and accessible. And the staff is super-helpful, even with slightly unusual requests.
reviews.title: Just different enough to be interesting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The elevators are fast, which is only worth mentioning because there is something odd about the engineering of the building. To get to the rooms, you first take one bank of elevators to the 4th floor, then walk in front of the bar/restaurant to another bank of elevators, which you then take to the remaining floors. Not a big deal, particularly, but when thinking about taking a quick trip up to the room for something, you find yourself weighing the time needed to wait for 4 elevators (not just 2).
reviews.title: No sound insulation between rooms

reviews.text: Since I was at the hotel for business, I can comment that the meeting rooms were perfect for the convening, and staff was attentive to most every detail I could notice.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Snack foods during the conference were great. Conference meals and my meals at the hotel restaurant were better than average, but not great.
reviews.title: Very Posh, nice stay

reviews.text: Room doors tended to slam shut, which meant some awakening during the night.
reviews.title: Clean and modern - really nice and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one weekend night as part of an evening on the town, and it was fun. Some of the hotel's quirkier aspects (a bit of a labyrinth to get to the hotel elevators, dim lighting in halls) made it more of an adventure. We loved the pillow selection, the mattress was very comfortable, the linens and toiletries were great. The carpet and (suede, very cool) furniture were just a touch worn, and the bathroom wall had some noticeable smudge marks near the wastebasket, but the overall impression was of a clean and mod boutique hotel. I would ask for a higher floor (we were on the 7th) so as to avoid the unfortunate view we had of a neighboring roof. The robes were a nice touch, but I agree with other reviewers that access to coffee in the room would have been great. The cocktail bar downstairs was a mostly positive experience and added to the charm. Very quiet stay, except when I was awakened at 3:30 am by a woman talking very loudly into her cell phone in the hall. (Seriously, what are people thinking??)
reviews.title: A great get-away

reviews.text: Loved the Graves 601. It was an easy train ride from the airport and close to Target Field and other shopping. It was a well appointed room with comfy bed. Loved the shower and television in the bathroom. The view left a lot to be desired, but I wasn't in the room much anyway.
reviews.title: Great hotel in the Twin Cities

reviews.text: Just returned from a business stay. Entire experience at the Graves 601 left me saying "never again". My Wednesday night stay was booked 3 months ago through our Corporate travel, with a King reserved. Upon check-in, I was told no King rooms available. Really? Three months in advance can't get me a King on a Wednesday? Surprising. Also at check-in I asked the Front Desk clerk if he could look up my Wyndham Rewards acct to be sure my stay was being credited. I was dismissed after what appeared to be a weak effort on his part to find me in their system--in his nicest British accent nonetheless. Huh, OK. I am offered a USA Today paper outside my door for the morning--nice touch, and I accept. I go up to my room to find NO 5 JET SHOWER--the only reason left to stay at the Graves. Wow. Ok, I decided to buy ($13) Internet access to look up on the Wyndham website my ID# so i can provide to the front desk--since they didn't seem interested in helping a member find her member # at check-in. Guess what? The TV doesn't work. I call the front desk and am told "There's no one here who can look at it and I wouldn't know how to help you troubleshoot it". Wow, OK. I ask to be moved to another room, only to be told "the only thing we might be able to do is get someone to clean a dirty room for you--which means it may take awhile"--it's 11pm at night so I decline. Why are there dirty rooms at 11pm if the hotel is full? I again call the front desk in HOPES of getting a different staff person than the rude young man who checked me in, and a young lady quickly finds my Wyndham Rewards # for me in their database. Thanks go out to her for being the only adequate Customer Service interaction this entire stay.Wow, OK. I go to sleep with no Jet Shower or TV, awake in the morning, and open my door to grab the USA Today I assume will be there--you guessed it, it isn't. Nice. I was at the Graves in April on business for 2 nights, and had poor Customer Service from the front desk at that visit as well: my group arrived in MN late on a Tuesday and we asked the front desk where we could go to eat dinner, a full menu, since we were starving. We were told "the Irish Pub next door". So we walk in the cold and rain only to be told the kitchen is already closed. Now wouldn't a hotel like the Graves have staff trained in knowing simple things like where to direct your guests to eat late in the evening? Both people at the front that night in April were both clueless. Unbelievable. Graves, I like your beds, I come for the Jet Shower, but I don't think i will return. I'm working with my Corporate travel to look at other options, like The Grand. Your decor is very posh, your bar is trendy and your gym is open 24/7, which is nice. But your room amenities and staff are poor and I cannot chance yet another stay like my last two. I don't know if you've had a change in Management or high staff turn over, but it shows. A real disappointment.
reviews.title: Not what it used to be--big disappointment.

reviews.text: This hotel is absolutely amazing. The room was immaculate, gorgeous and we were just in awe as we were walking up to our room. Additionally, it's right across from the First Ave venue where we were going to see Death Cab for Cutie and it was an awesome location. I want to live in this hotel. Added plus: You can sit on the toilet, talk on the phone and watch TV on a flat screen (mounted in front of the toilet haha) at the same time.
reviews.title: UHmazing room/service/location

reviews.text: From the staff, the room and the "extras" the Graves 601 has now become our top related hotel in Minneapolis. We've stayed at The Marquette, The Westin, The Hyatt, The Grand Hotel, etc. and none matched the Graves for what matters most.
reviews.title: Easter Weekend Getaway

description: A 22-story high hotel with a history of excellence, Graves 601 Hotel is located at the confluence of business, theatre, and entertainment districts. We are connected by Skyway to the entire shopping and business district.Our rooms are quipped with high tech-high fashion design with plasma TVs, hand crafted headboards, rain showers in bath - Opposite Target Center.
